overview:
Greg Elofson, JD, PhD, is the Founder and CEO of Tiny News.

Dr. Elofson has 20 years experience as an entrepreneur, institution builder, project director, academic, consultant, and scientist.

Previously, as Founder and CEO of Shopbee.com, he built a location-based iPhone-app startup, for local-based retail sales, right as mobile was taking off.

As co-founder of the Institute of Electronic Commerce at Emory Universityâ€™s Goizueta School of Business, he became a thought-leader in Mass-Personalization. And prior to that, he was co-director of the Intelligent Computer Systems Research Institute, where he pioneered intelligent-agent systems for strategic planning and forecasting political insurrection.

Dr. Elofson was the Principal Investigator on several +million dollar projects, including computer vision systems, and knowledge/behavior acquisition systems, as a Staff Scientist in the AI Architectures Group at SAIC.

He began his IT career as a consultant in the Phoenix and Dallas offices of Arthur Andersen & Co.

Dr. Elofson has been a reviewer for the National Science Foundation, given talks internationally at institutions such as the London School of Economics, Asian Institute of Technology, Simon Fraser University, and many others.

milestones.description: Greg founded Tiny News, a new media startup.
